text:
KeyKeg (TCBW2017)
Crazy sweet toasty aroma, very buttery. Black, dark heaed. Sweet chocolatey taste. Heavy body, a bit sticky, carbonation low. Really not so drinkable, as itÂ’s so crazily sweet. Alcohol not so hidden despite the ton of sugars. Actual barrel aspect rather low, itÂ’s more like they just upended a bottle into this. A bit of a sweeeet boozy mess, but does get neurons firing in the pleasure centres of my lizard brain.

Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, red session. Dark brown color with a bit of brownish head. Aroma has cocoa powder, milk chocolate and some vanilla extract. Taste is smooth, well balanced, sweetish but balanced out by a roasty and cacao bitterness.

On tap at TCBW 2017. Pours dark brown, almost black colour. High beige head. Lots of vanilla, cocoa, milk chocolate in the aroma. Vanilla and cocoa at first. Slight notes of alcochol, bitter chocolate and cocoa in the middle. Oak and notes of alcochol in the end. Surprisingly light bodied in the context of barrel aged imperial stouts. Very good brew, but too much alcochol in the taste still. Wonder how it tastes after 6 months or a year.
Sample @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Red Session 20170513. Roasted malty with chocolate, vanilla and coffee, bourbon, woody notes, sweet, full body.
[5/13/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Red session. Dark brown. Chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, bourbon, quite full-bodied.

MBCC 2017. Opaque black beer with a nice creamy beige head. I loved the original version here, and this is great as well. Vanilla aroma, chocolate, caramel, licorice, some tar notes. Vanilla and chocolate flavor, licorice, woody notes, warming alcohol, caramel, some cacao nibs. Great beer.
From tap. Black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, coconut, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full silky oily body with soft carbonation.
Sample at MBCC. Pours black. Aroma is chocolate, wood, balanced. Taste is sweet, chocolate, smooth, creamy.

Tap. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, wood, vanilla, alcohol and dark fruit. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and with bitter notes. Mediu bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Impy. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
Sample at MBCC 2017. Black with a tan head. Sweetish with dark malt, caramel, bourbon, vanilla and some dark fruit. The body was full and the mouthfeel was kind of creamy.

MBCC. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 130517
Sample @ MBCC, Red session. Black pour with a small tan head. Notes of light roast, sweet vanilla, milk chocolate, fudge and some light cocoa.
Tap at TCBW. Pours black with beige head. Aroma is massive vanilla, roast, chocolate. Flavor is sweet, vanilla, roast, malt, chocolate. Overall: very good.

Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Notes of smooth bourbon, chocolate, coffee, toffee, vanilla, light coconut, licorice, light mint. Smooth texture, light carbonation. A great beer.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2017 Keg at cbc17 Red... Dark black. .. Thin tan lacing.. . Soft dark chocolate roast malts... Light vanilla nose.. . Soft sweet caramel toffee chocolate roast malts.. . Soft sweet vanilla chocolate 3.9

Keg at CBC17 yellow .. dark black ... thin tan lacing ... dark dry coconut chocolate roast malt nose ... sweet chocolate malts ... heavy sweet measty coconut chocolate roast 4.0
Sample at MBCC 2017. Dark malty smell with chocolate. Similar taste, sweet with caramel and bourbon. Creamy mouthfeel. Nice!

13-MAY-2017, draft @MBCC 2017, Red Session, with UlklÃ¸bben.
Black with a lasting, slightly lacing, tan head.
Aroma is Bourbon, Wood, chocolate. Taste is Bourbon, alcohol, Vanilla. Sweet and full. Nice.

Tap @TCBW 2017. Pitch black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Alcohol, dark chocolate, roast, sweet, vanilla, woody and cinnamon buns in aroma. Aroma is like cinnamon buns hug you while you are still in bed. Alcohol, dark chocolate, woody, roast, sweet and vanilla in taste. Cinnamon, roast and dark chocolate in aftertaste. Oaky, woody mouthfeel. Very solid brew.

Tap @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017   Czarny jak smoÅ‚a trunek. Po nalaniu moÅ¼na godzinami podziwiaÄ‡ grubÄ…, puszystÄ… i zwartÄ… kremowÄ… pianÄ™. Drobne ziarenka wydajÄ… siÄ™ tworzyÄ‡ jednÄ… caÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡.
W aromacie cukierki kukuÅ‚ki, ciasteczka czekoladowe, wanilia, kokos, pralinki belgijskie, ciasteczka maÅ›lane "Kokosanki". W smaku potÄ™Å¼nie beczkowe GIGANTYCZNIE zÅ‚oÅ¼one, perfekcyjnie zbalansowane. Moc nut wanilii, kokosÃ³w, drewna, dÄ™biny. Wszystko rozsÄ…dnie przemyÅ›lane. Wydaje siÄ™, Å¼e kaÅ¼dy detal gra tutaj kluczowÄ… rolÄ™.
GÅ‚adkie. Kremowe. SÅ‚odkie. WyklejajÄ…ce usta i podniebienie. Po prostu PIÄ˜KNE!
On tap @ MBCC 2015. Dark brown with no head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit, chocolate, vanilla and hops. Full body with a bitter / chocolate finish.

Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2017. Day 2.


Black stuff with a tan head. Chocolate, sweetness, rich taste, so awesome!
Tap @MBCC2017, Red Session. Black, tiny beige head. Aroma has bourbon, wood, vanilla, cocoa. Sweet flavour, syrupy coffee and booze. Woody, vanilla note.

13.05.2017, tap @ MBCC:
Tiny bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is sweet, dark sugar, maple syrup, caramel, minerals, dark malts, bourbon, vanilla, nuts, hay, toffee. Taste is slightly dry roasted, dark malts, nuts, toffee, chocolate, dark sugar, maple syrup, minerals, bourbon, oak, vanilla, toast. Medium bitterness, slightly dry roasted mouthfeel. Nice.

Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Red Session. Sehr dunkel orange braunes Bier. Geruch ist sÃ¼ÃŸ rÃ¶stmalzig, Kaffee, bourbon. Geschmack ist sÃ¼ÃŸ karamellig, Vanille, Schokolade, bourbon, top.
Tap @ mbcc 2017. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with coffee, chocolate and coconut. Dry finish.

Draught @ MBCC 2017. Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee, cocoa, coconut, chocolate and oak. Taste is smooth, slightly roasty and sweetish with some cocoa, chocolate and oak. Finish is sweetish, roasty and smooth with some wood, oak, chocolate, syrup and vanilla. Okay.

Tap at MBCC 2017. Pours black, no head. Very smooth and balanced. Chocolate, coffee, coconut, oak, maple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at mbcc17, copenhagen. Black color, smooth brown head. Very smooth aroma has cocoa, coffee, chocolate, some oak notes. Ultra smooth and soft mouthfeel, cocoa, chocolate, hint of oak.
Tap at TCBW2017, Tallinn. Colour is almost black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, coffee, mint? (martini?) and roasted malts. Very good and interesting.
@tcbw17black. Sugary sweet nose, roasty, bÃ¶ack vanilla. Full bodied, drinkable, smooth. Vanilla cocoa, roasty smooth. Excellent.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
The best at TCBW 2017. Wild. Sophisticated roasted boogie. Some choco. Lusciously sweet. Combine mÃ¤mmi and vanilla ice cream and youÂ’ve got this. Awesome. IÂ’m biased.
0,1l on tap @ TCBW 2017. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, chocolate and whisky. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, chocolate, whisky, oak and hops. Sublime.
On tap at TCBW, Tallinn. Black with a beige head. Roasty aroma with a fair amount of vanilla, some dark chocolate and dark fruits. Complex, vinous and feels somehow surprisingly light. Pure pleasure!
Tap at TCBW. Dark brown beer, medium beige head. Nose is chocolate, bourbon, malt, roast, toffee, cocoa. Flavor is sweet, but not overly so, chocolate and alcohol, vanilla and cocoa. Very nice.

Blackish brown colour with beige smallish head on top. Aroma has vanilla beans, cookie dough, Bourbon barrel, syrup, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Awesomeness. Taste has dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, Bourbon barrel, wooden note, vanilla, wow. Full oily body with lowish carbonation. Just damn good.

Tap na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa. Wow, genialnie pachnie, jest sporo wanilii, pralin, kokosa, mlecznej czekolady. Smak sÅ‚odki, czekolada, waniliia, kokos. Bardzo blisko poziomu Vanilla Shake BBA. Cudownie gÅ‚adkie, duÅ¼e ciaÅ‚o, pÅ‚ynny aksamit.
WFP backlog. Cos niesamowitego. Genialnie zbanalsowane, masa czekolady, toffi, ciasteczek orzechowych, do wanilia, dÄ™bina. SÅ‚odkie, oleiste. Klasa

Kran na WFP, absolutny Sztos przez duÅ¼e S, najlepsze piwo festiwalu. Wanilia, czekolada, marcepan, kokos, orzechy, praliny. Genialnie gÄ™ste i wyklejajÄ…ce, alkohol ukryty idealnie. Chyba najlepsze piwo jakie piÅ‚em w Å¼yciu.

JuÅ¼ podstawowÄ… wersjÄ™ uwaÅ¼am za wybitne piwo i totalnÄ… czekoladowÄ… bombÄ™. Tu dzieje siÄ™ jeszcze wiÄ™cej - do pralin, mlecznej czekolady, kakao dochodzi jeszcze delikatne drewno i wanilia. CiaÅ‚o wciÄ…Å¼ oleiÅ›cie gÄ™ste, sÅ‚odycz na tym samym poziomie co w podstawce .Perfekcyjny, wzorowy balans.

Beczka na WFP2017

Nieskromnie mÃ³wiÄ…c najlepsze wedÅ‚ug mnie piwo festiwalu! To co zrobiÅ‚a beczka z piwem bazowym to kosmos. Sama podstawa to juÅ¼ klasa w sobie, ale beczka wyciÄ…gnela maksimum z piwa. Mamy tutaj jeszcze lepiej uÅ‚oÅ¼one nuty czekolady, czekolady i jeszcze raz czekolady. Do tego wanilia z beczki, kakao, sÅ‚odkÄ… kawÄ™ z mleczkiem skondensowanym.
Alkohol Å›wietnie schowany. CieszÄ™ siÄ™, Å¼e mogÅ‚em "laÄ‡" to piwo na festiwalu! Zdrowie ;)
Tap at Warszawski Festiwal Piwa. A lot of barrel, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, sweetness. An awesome beer, I canÂ’t describe it properly, prefer to sip.

WFP. Czarne, nieprzejrzyste z minimalna, beÅ¼owÄ… pianÄ…. Aromat to slodka, mleczna czekolada, kakao, wanilia, wyraÅºnie wyczuwalna beczka. Ponadto karmel, toffi, tiramius. Smak slodki, dÅ‚ugi, czekolada, wanilia, beczka. PodsumowujÄ…c wersja BA jest o poziom lepsza od bazowej, piwo maksymalnie uÅ‚oÅ¼one, sÅ‚odkie, wyciska z beczki to co najlepsze.
WFP Backlog. Vanilla, chocolate, almonds, milk, barrel, marshmallows. Heavy sweet.
Absolutny sztos, rozjebaÅ‚ mi mÃ³zg. Ocena przeniesiona z untapped w celu uzupeÅ‚nienia profilu na ratebeer. Lane na wfp

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 Tap at WFP. Black beer with beige head. Rich, intense aroma of milk chocolate with strong vanilla, some cocoa, dark fruits, light almond, marzipan. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter, of chocolate pralines, vanilla, latte coffee, cocoa, light almond, marzipan. A bit roasty finish with more chocolate and vanilla. Full body, oily, smooth texture, soft to average carbonation. Simply incredible - sweet, but not falling out of balance, with more vanilla than in regular version, great flavour depth, body, density, just carbonation could be slightly lower. Close to perfect.

Pite na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa. Co tu siÄ™ dzieje to jest poezja. Aromat jest genialny praliny, mega wanilia i kokos, beczka. DuÅ¼o ciaÅ‚a, jest wyklejajÄ…ce, alkohol ukryty idealnie. Jest intensywny kokos, jeszcze coÅ› w stylu ptasiego mleczka duÅ¼o wanilii oblanej czekoladÄ…, poza tym beczka teÅ¼ wniosÅ‚a tu bardzo duÅ¼o. Genialne piwo.
W aromacie czekolada, kawa, Å›wietna wanilia i kokos od beczki. W smaku gÅ‚adkie, gÄ™ste, czekoladowe, beczkowe. Najlepsze piwo festiwalu.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 Kran WFP ?17: czarne, z ladna, drobna i trwala pianka. W aromacie intensywna czekolada, wanilia, praliny, kakao, cappuccino. W smaku przyjemnie slodkie, czekoladowe, waniliowe, do tego toffi, karmel, ciasto tiramisu. Super schowane alko, pieknie geste, lepkie cialo, niskie wysycenie, dlugie posmaki risa i beczki. Ogolnie bardzo wyraziste i pyszne piwo - zdecydowanie nr 1 calego WFP 2017!
duzo beczki, sporo wanilli, kakao, geste, dlugi posmak czekoladowy, wanilliowy bardzo dobre

Rami Rami is drinking a SippinÂ’ Into Darkness Barrel Aged by Lervig at Warszawski Festiwal Piwa

Urywa dupe beczkowoscia, slodycza, migdalami, czekolada, kawa, a nad tym wszystkim mocna wanilia. Bardzo zlozone. Ciala nie malo. #teamslodyczka. Extraklasa
